title: Angels and acorns: Tasmanian 'colonial' stone carvings
creator_credit: Norman Laird, Rodney Musch, Lindo Taylor and Tasfilm Productions
brief_description: Illustrates the use of Australian sculpture in Tasmania from its earliest days to the end of the last century. Work of convict origin is shown including Ross Bridge with its notable sculptures and gargoyles. Photographer: Rodney Musch. Commentator: Bert Wicks.
creator_credit_for_label: Norman Laird, Rodney Musch, Lindo Taylor and Tasfilm Productions
